result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander M Bruckner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. Fine/costs paid in full from cash bond posted.

Consecutive to 14-CT-25. Huber release and good time granted. Defendant can be released 8/25/14 for 8 hour furlough. Must report back to jail by 4:30 PM. If defendant needs more time, he can request it.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. Fine/costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander M Bruckner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses Ct. 3 but reads in for sentencing purposes. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Gregory A Gerbers.  Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in custody.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Atty Maciolek asks that file track Br. 2 files.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint.  Arraignment scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Defendant was fingeprinted 6/01/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 8/27/14)
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. Not to be in any bars or taverns that serve alcohol.

Defendant Alexander M Bruckner appears by video conference along with attorney Eric S Maciolek, who appears in person.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.
